entry.title: CHRISTMAS TREE PERMITS AVAILABLE FOR UMPQUA NATIONAL FOREST
entry.summary: November 25, 2024 3:20 a.m. Christmas tree permits are now available to purchase at Forest Service offices, several local businesses, and online through: https://www.recreation.gov/. To purchase a Christmas tree permit online, go to the https://www.recreation.gov/ site and search for the Umpqua National Forest Christmas Tree Permits. It is important to carefully read the overview and...

entry.title: WILDLIFE SAFARI REGISTRATION STILL OPEN FOR TURKEY TROT
entry.summary: November 25, 2025 3:05 a.m. Wildlife Safari still has registration open for the Turkey Trot event happening on Thursday – Thanksgiving morning. entry.title: MERKLEY, WYDEN CALL FOR EMERGENCY FUNDING FOR WILDFIRE RECOVERY
entry.summary: November 25, 2025 2:50 a.m. On Monday, Oregon’s U.S. Senators Jeff Merkley and Ron Wyden joined fellow western senators to urge Congress to pass additional funding to support wildfire recovery on public lands. A joint release said in a letter to Senate Appropriation Committee Chair Susan Collins, and Vice Chair Patty Murray, the senators pressed...

entry.title: Domino’s in Winston to Donate 50% of Sales to Winston-Dillard Food Bank on Dec. 1
entry.summary: Domino’s in Winston will donate 50% of sales on Dec. 1 from 5–8 p.m. to the Winston-Dillard Food Bank during a special meet-the-owner event. Guests can bring canned food for $1 off purchases and enjoy activities, giveaways, and a chance to meet new franchise owner Angelique Martinez.

entry.title: INSIDE DOUGLAS COUNTY 11.24.25
entry.summary: A two segment program with Ali Shaver of Wildlife Safari talking about holiday events, and Roseburg Dream Center Co-Director Jeremy Grammon talking about the increased need for help they are seeing in the community and how residents can help.

entry.title: MORNING CONVERSATION 11.24.25
entry.summary: Seven Feathers Casino Resort Marketing Director Harold Phillips and Cow Creek Umpqua Tribe of Indians Communications and Marketing Director Lindsay Campman talk about their Light the Sky Event happening Friday, as they kick off a lighting display at the casino, which has over 1 million lights.

entry.title: Winston-Dillard, Riddle, other school districts take a look at attendance, on track rates
entry.summary: Lookingglass Elementary School Principal Emily Ledbetter said the school and Winston-Dillard School District as a whole implemented a new attendance progress three years ago, with a big focus on family partnerships.

entry.title: South Umpqua High School serves Thanksgiving lunch
entry.summary: TRI CITY — South Umpqua High School held Thanksgiving lunch Friday, inviting over 450 students, staff and administration to partake in the traditionally festive foods.

entry.title: FREE FISHING DAYS FRIDAY AND SATURDAY AFTER THANKSGIVING
entry.summary: November 24, 2025 2:50 a.m. The Oregon Department of Fish and Wildlife is offering free fishing days this Friday and Saturday, right after Thanksgiving. An ODFW release said no fishing or shellfish licenses or tags are required for those two days. All other fishing regulations apply including closures, bag limits, and size restrictions. Both Oregon...

entry.title: First Annual Umpqua Valley Food Rally Brings in Over $2,000 and More Than a Ton of Food
entry.summary: The first annual Umpqua Valley Food Rally collected 2,176 pounds of food and raised $2,128 to support families across Douglas County. Planned in just three weeks, the event drew strong community turnout and organizers say it will now become an annual tradition.

entry.title: WAID to Host Free Community Christmas Celebration on December 12
entry.summary: WAID will host the 2025 Free Community Christmas on Dec. 12 at the Winston Community Center, featuring Santa, live entertainment, contests, a cake walk, refreshments, and raffle prizes. The event is free for all, with donations still welcomed to support the celebration.

entry.title: 3rd Annual Winston-Dillard Festival Association Christmas Ball Set for Dec. 13
entry.summary: The 3rd Annual Winston-Dillard Festival Association Christmas Ball returns Dec. 13 with live music by Borrowed Time, refreshments by Freed Estate Winery, and a festive evening of dancing at the Winston Community Center. Tickets are on sale now.

entry.title: Year-round nutrition with sweet potatoes
entry.summary: Sweet potatoes are quite possibly my favorite food. They can be made in so many ways, savory or sweet, and they are good for you.

entry.title: The FISH of Roseburg Food Pantry holds first The Umpqua Valley Food Rally in Roseburg
entry.summary: Before Barbara Clithero drove away from The Umpqua Valley Food Rally and volunteers sorted through her donated bag of food, she said it was for one reason: Her duty to her community.

entry.title: Douglas County Commissioners issue rural health proclamation, approve court grants
entry.summary: Wednesday's Douglas County Board of Commissioners meeting was focused on wellness and recovery, specifically for those who provide health care and specialty court services and those who receive them.

entry.title: Primary sources: Roseburg High School hosts veterans in Salute to Service

entry.title: Local FFA chapters represent at the National FFA Convention
entry.summary: INDIANAPOLIS — At the 98th National FFA Convention & Expo, chapters from Douglas County joined with over 60,0000 other FFA members from across the country.
